name: Feedscatteron Computing System
description: A Feedscatteron-based computational system that transcends traditional computing

content.content: Similar to Ohm's law, but applicable to Feedscatteron flow. Where I_k is the Feedscatteron current intensity, U_k is the Feedscatteron voltage, and R is the Feedscatteron resistance.

rows: Decay cycle shortened to 27.1ms, extremely dangerous

content.content: When current intensity I_k > 6A, Feedscatteron undergoes accelerated decay, with the decay cycle drastically shortening from the normal 34.28 seconds to 27.1ms, releasing massive amounts of heat and potentially causing system collapse.
To prevent Feedscatteron from colliding with pipe walls and increasing current intensity I_k, the system employs a Fluid Titanium circular motion protection mechanism:

items: Purpose: Prevent pipe wall collisions that increase I_k
Concentration Requirement: 1.2 mmol/L⁻¹
Effect: Feedscatteron turns in perfect arcs
Advantage: Zero kinetic energy loss, efficient transmission

content.content: The special molecular structure of Fluid Titanium enables Feedscatteron to:

items: Turn with zero kinetic energy loss
Achieve high-speed data transmission
Maintain stable quantum states
Operate with extremely low energy consumption (almost no heat generation)

content.content: Single silicon chip floating-point computational capacity: 6.7 × 10⁴ billion times that of human supercomputers

items: Single-core floating-point operations: Far exceeds contemporary supercomputers
Parallel processing capability: Supports massive concurrency
Energy efficiency: Extremely low (almost no heat generation)
Response speed: Near-instantaneous
Human brain-level consciousness simulation
Real-time environmental perception processing
Complex decision-making computation
Memory storage and retrieval
Emotional pattern computation

content.content: The decay cycle of Feedscatteron in different media determines its viability as a storage medium:
Liquid Titanium is currently the best known medium for preserving Feedscatteron, capable of extending the decay cycle to over 300,000 years, making the long-term existence of Synthetics possible.

items: CPU/GPU Computational Medium: Replacing traditional silicon-based chips
Brain Reconstruction: Complete replication of human brain structure and function
Memory Carrier: Storing a human lifetime of memories
Consciousness Simulation: Running complete copies of human consciousness
Environmental Perception: Real-time processing of sensor data
Decision Systems: Supporting complex logical reasoning

content.content: Despite the powerful performance of the Feedscatteron computing system, some limitations remain:

content.title: Current Technical Limitations
content: Material Scarcity: Fluid Titanium is difficult to obtain and extremely expensive
Current Control: Must be strictly controlled below 6A
Environmental Dependency: Requires specific temperature and pressure conditions
Decay Risk: Rapid decay under high current may cause system collapse

content.content: These limitations mean that Feedscatteron computing systems cannot yet be widely deployed, and are only used for special purposes such as Synthetic consciousness computation.
